Package simulation.montecarlo

Class OutputWriter

java.lang.Object
simulation.montecarlo.OutputWriter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, AutoCloseable
public class OutputWriter extends Object implements Closeable
Manages the output of a simulation

  • Nested Class Summary

    Class
    Description
    static class 
    OutputWriter.Builder
    A builder class for creating instances of OutputWriter

    The type of output - verbose, binned or per spin info

    Whether to print the output to the console (as opposed to saving to a file)

    printProgress
    Whether to print the progress of the simulation using a terminal progress bar and percentage

    • OutputWriter

      public OutputWriter​(OutputWriter.Builder builder)
      Creates a new OutputWriter with all configuration options that have been specified by calling methods on the given builder.
      Parameters:
      builder - builder with all required and optional configuration options that have been specified by calling methods on it.

    • print

      public void print​(String toPrint, boolean lineBreak) throws IOException
      Uses the FileWriter or the Console to write out the given string.
      Parameters:
      toPrint - String to print (to console or to a file)
      lineBreak - whether a line break should be appended at the end of the string
      Throws:
      IOException

      Specified by:

      IOException

    • makeTableHeader

      public String makeTableHeader()
      Constructs table headers using the colNames array
      Returns:
      a row of column names separated by whitespace so that they constitute table headers

    • writeObservablesVerbose

      public void writeObservablesVerbose​(long sweeps, double m, double currentEnergy, double magField0, double magField1, double magField2, double magField3, double magField4, double magField5, double magField6, double magField7, double spinSizes0, double spinSizes1, double mk2x, double mk2y, double mk2z, boolean lastSwapAccepted)
      Writes a row of results into outputBuffer
      Parameters:
      sweeps - row number (sweep index)
      m - magnetization
      currentEnergy - energy
      magField0 - mean of local Bx
      magField1 - std of local Bx
      magField2 - mean of local By
      magField3 - std of local By
      magField4 - mean of local Bz
      magField5 - std of local Bz
      magField6 - maximal transverse magnetic field
      magField7 - maximal longitudinal magnetic field
      spinSizes0 - mean of magnetic moments
      spinSizes1 - std of magnetic moments
      mk2x - |m(k_x)|^2
      mk2y - |m(k_y)|^2
      mk2z - |m(k_z)|^2
      lastSwapAccepted - whether the last swap attempt between temperature (in parallel tempering) was accepted

    • writeObservablesPerSpin

      public void writeObservablesPerSpin​(int n, int spin, double spinSize, double localBx, double localBy, double localBz)
      Writes a row of the lattice output to outputBuffer
      Parameters:
      n - row number (spin index)
      spin - the spin orientation
      spinSize - the magnetic moment of the spin
      localBx - local magnetic field in the x direction
      localBy - local magnetic field in the y direction
      localBz - local magnetic field in the z direction

    • writeObservablesBin

      public void writeObservablesBin​(long currentBinCount, double[] binAvg, double acceptanceRateForBin)
      Writes a row of results into outputBuffer in the binned format
      Parameters:
      currentBinCount - number of samples in the current bin
      binAvg - an array of observable averages over the bin
      acceptanceRateForBin - average acceptance rate for the bin

    • writeSwapAcceptance

      public void writeSwapAcceptance​(boolean swapAccepted)
      Appends the last acceptance state of the parallel tempering attempt to the end of a row
      Parameters:
      swapAccepted - whether the last attempt was accepted

    • makeTableRowFormat

      public String makeTableRowFormat​(char[] colTypes)
      Formats the data to a row with the required widths and numeric types
      Parameters:
      colTypes - array containing the numeric types of the columns
      Returns:
      String used by a java Formatter object to construct a row with the given widths in the given format
      See Also:
      Class Formatter

    • avgArrToString

      public String avgArrToString​(double[] avgArr, long N, int startIndex)
      Given an array of (un-averaged) bin data to write as a row in the results, automatically averages over the bin and constructs a string for that row in the given format (correct column widths)
      Parameters:
      avgArr - array of bin data to average and format in columns
      N - number of samples in bin
      startIndex - where to start in the colWidths array (currently the first column is treated separately, so should be 1)
      Returns:
      a string of the averaged bin data
      See Also:
      Class Formatter

    • getBufferSize

      public int getBufferSize()

    • getFolderName

      public String getFolderName()

    • getOutType

      public OutputType getOutType()
